page.title: 17TRAVEL IN BUCKLAND BREWER
page.content: APART FROM THOSE ENGAGED IN FARMING OR EMPLOYED AT THE ONE LOCAL FACTORY OR CORN MILL, THERE IS LITTLE WORK IN THE AREA SURVEYED. THIRTY-SIX PERCENT OF THOSE EMPLOYED WORK EITHER AT HOME OR WITHIN TWO MILES OF HOME. FORTY-FOUR PERCENT TRAVEL BETWEEN TWO AND TEN MILES TO WORK EACH DAY, WHILE NINE PERCENT TRAVEL MORE THAN TEN MILES DAILY TO THEIR PLACE OF WORK. NO PERSON WAS FOUND TO HAVE A DAILY JOURNEY GREATER THAN TWENTY MILES EACH WAY, APART FROM SOME OF THE ELEVEN PERCENT WHOSE EMPLOYMENT IS OF A TRAVELLING NATURE OR WHO UNDERTAKE CONTRACTS AT A VARIETY OF LOCATIONS.
